title: Scaffold buildable skeleton (CMake core DLL + WPF app stub)
body:
Goal:
- Stand up a buildable Core DLL and a minimal WPF app stub.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- CMake config produces a DLL target for the core.
- WPF app project builds (even with placeholder UI).
- CI can build both on Windows without hard failures when optional parts are missing.

Notes:
- Keep implementations minimal; focus on structure and buildability.

title: Define C-API surface + memory/JSON conventions (cs_free etc.)
body:
Goal:
- Document and implement the initial C-API surface, including memory ownership and JSON conventions.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- C-API headers define core entry points and `cs_free` (or equivalent).
- JSON request/response patterns are documented in repo docs.
- ABI expectations are explicit and stable.

Notes:
- Keep the surface minimal and forward-compatible.

title: Implement Core Cart MVP (add/remove/clear/total)
body:
Goal:
- Implement cart operations in the C++ core.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- Add/remove/clear/total operations are implemented and unit-tested.
- Monetary values follow int64 cents rule.

Notes:
- Keep the API minimal; add extra fields only if required for MVP.

title: Implement Payment MVP (given/change)
body:
Goal:
- Implement payment calculation basics in the core.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- Given/change calculations are implemented with unit tests.
- Edge cases (exact payment, rounding policy) are defined.

Notes:
- Keep the behavior deterministic and documented.

title: Catalog load from JSON (core)
body:
Goal:
- Load catalog data from JSON in the core.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- JSON schema documented (even if minimal).
- Core can parse a catalog JSON and expose it to the C-API.

Notes:
- Favor forward-compatible schema with versioning hints.

title: WPF Proof-of-Life: buttons -> C-API -> UI refresh
body:
Goal:
- Demonstrate the WPF UI calling into the C-API and showing results.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- At least one button triggers a C-API call.
- UI refreshes with returned data.
- Errors are surfaced in a basic, visible way.

Notes:
- Keep UI minimal; focus on the end-to-end signal.

title: CustomerDisplayWindow (2nd screen support)
body:
Goal:
- Add a stub customer display window for second-screen support.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- Customer display window can be opened independently.
- Placeholder content renders without crashing.

Notes:
- No final styling needed; proof-of-life only.

title: CI workflow: Windows build core + app (+ tests if present)
body:
Goal:
- Ensure CI builds core and app, running tests when available.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- CI builds core via CMake on Windows.
- CI builds WPF app when a csproj exists.
- Tests run if present; otherwise steps skip gracefully.

Notes:
- Avoid hard failures for missing scaffolds.

title: Core unit tests for cart/payment + ctest integration
body:
Goal:
- Add core unit tests and integrate with CTest.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- Cart and payment logic has unit tests.
- Tests register with CTest and run in CI when available.

Notes:
- Keep tests fast and deterministic.

title: Release workflow: tag -> zip artifacts (best-effort)
body:
Goal:
- Package artifacts on tag push.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- Release workflow creates a ZIP with available build outputs.
- Workflow handles missing app outputs without failing.

Notes:
- Use official or well-known actions only.

title: Error handling strategy (error codes + last-error string/json)
body:
Goal:
- Define error handling patterns for the core and C-API.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- Error codes documented.
- Last-error string/JSON pattern defined and accessible via C-API.

Notes:
- Keep the contract stable and simple.

title: Basic soak test checklist doc
body:
Goal:
- Document a lightweight soak test checklist.

Acceptance Criteria (DoD):
- Checklist covers core cart, payment, and UI smoke passes.
- Document lives under docs/ with clear ownership.

Notes:
- Keep it short and practical.
